website_summaries.verdict: A long dog training leash that is great for teaching your dog recalls.
pros: Leash is 20 feet long, so you can allow your dog to wander and ensure it follows your commands
Nylon leash is designed to outlast its cotton counterparts
Features a swivel-style bolt snap that resists twisting
cons: Leash handle may snap after extended use
Dogs may be able to chew through the leash

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: Love this leash! I got the 50ft which I think was maybe a little to 2 long lol great for letting my boy run around without me needing to chase him all over the farm! Lightweight but sturdy, the latch held up to my 70+lb puppy pulling and lunging trying to play with our friend. Love it might get another in Orange.
customer_reviews.author: caitlyn

customer_reviews.title: Very nice recall lead for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Fast delivery, lead as described and I’m very happy with it. We use it for our 67lb coonhound. It’s great for taking her to a lake, It floats well and allows her safe freedom in the water. I also use it for obedience recall. If this one ever wears out I will definitely buy another. I use the orange so it is easy to see on both land and water. I recommend spray lubricant on the clasp so it doesn’t stick with use in sand and water.
customer_reviews.author: 79Blizzard

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Best way to train your dog how far to travel off lead. We used this consistently the first few months on hikes. My dog now stays 20ft ahead or behind and stops each time. She mentally thinks that 20 ft is how far she should be away from us and then stops or comes back to us. It was a great way to train her on hikes and walking with a lead. We also just let it drag behind her for miles and miles and it never snagged or even looks dirty.
customer_reviews.author: DHART

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy with it
customer_reviews.text: Wrap one end around a tree, insert the other end through the loop of a dog leash, connect that other end to a hook on your deck, and you have a way for your dog to run (fairly) freely around a rental yard with no fence for small periods -- at a fraction of the price of other solutions. The orange color is also a plus when it comes to the rental's landscapers; with it stretched taught so it's up off the ground, there's no way they can claim they didn't see it! I'm happy with it, at least.
customer_reviews.author: Kristian Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Great product all around
customer_reviews.text: Great product, excellent price & arrived quickly. I got the 30foot for my puppy & it's already been put to good use. We can take her to a field and allow her to run with freedom while staying safe until she learns to come on command. Great leash for teaching recall. Also came in handy while camping to keep her tied up at our campsite. The hook is not too heavy for a little dog. Mine is only an 8 lb Malshi. The material is lightweight but durable & the orange color is good for visibility.
customer_reviews.author: Sealya

customer_reviews.title: So much fun
customer_reviews.text: Buying this leash has made my life so much fun. I have a 4 lb Yorkie that I don't trust to come when I call her. Now, I can tie her to a tree, log, rock, younameit, and not worry about her running away forever. She has enough room to explore while I do my own thing. In the event that we do accidentally let go of the leash (we have) it's so easy to catch our pup. My husband put it nicely, "It's like having a 30-foot dog."
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Banana

customer_reviews.title: The long leash is nice for giving her the illusion of being "off-leash" while ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 30 feet which will give my pup a 60' length to run from one side of it to the other, if I am in the middle. 60' is the approx diameter of the open area in which we can train and she can play safely, so 30' will do it. The long leash is nice for giving her the illusion of being "off-leash" while still maintaining safety. And it's pretty in pink-- tres fashion-forward.
customer_reviews.author: Babs

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware! Poor quality and tears apart
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this leash on the impression it would be good quality based on many reviews. After only a few weeks of use, the items i already tearing apart near the hook! Have a look at the photos yourself. I have contacted Zhu Xuan Ke via amazon TWICE already with a promise that a reply would be given within two days.. Both times-- NO REPLY! It seems like their customer support is only concerned about replying to Negative Reviews only to remediate any issues. That's not how customer service should be done. Buyer beware, if you want to waste ~10$ on a leash, by all means buy this item-- just don't expect any quality in return.
customer_reviews.author: lVlasterchief

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Even Last 6 Months
customer_reviews.text: Used as a tie out leash. It tends to form its position where it lays and dry-rots extremely easily. It would snap with almost no effort after the second rain. I've been repairing and tying it on and off for the past 3 months to keep it working, but it has now snapped near the collar lock. Can't say I'd recommend this for long use. Maybe for walking dogs in sunshine.
customer_reviews.author: Nick H.

customer_reviews.title: Evidently not as well made as I touught
customer_reviews.text: I was very happy with this leash when I first got it. Neither the lead nor the clip were too heavy for my 20-lb dog and the 30-foot length was perfect for allowing him some relative freedom to run in the park. After only about six uses, however, the leash strap just snapped right below the clip and there was my dog running across the park. Miraculously I was able to call him back (this was a relatively new rescue pup) but it could have ended badly.
customer_reviews.author: Knitnut

customer_reviews.title: Handle Snapped First Use - Very Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: I got the 15ft to practice training with my corgi puppy. It broke the first time we used it. He wasn’t even pulling hard (walking, not even running) and the handle broke off from the rest of the leash. The description says the sewing is “reinforced” but obviously not well. My dog doesn’t even weight 30 pounds and it snapped almost instantly. This is a horrible product that I wish I hadn’t spent money on. I’ve seen other users ask about much stronger dogs than mine - don’t buy this product! Spend a little more money and get something much stronger!
customer_reviews.author: TheGreatSamboni

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: This item broke the first time I used it. I have a medium sized dog and I had put her on the leash for less than 15 minutes before she broke it.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Dobozy

customer_reviews.title: Good product/bad product/need stronger product
customer_reviews.text: Will hold my GSP just fine. Getting to where I need a lighter leash for training and this fits the bill. I have a GSP puppy. Update: my gsp bit through the leash, it took him one bite. Update again. Attempted to fix in case the dog hit a weak spot. The puppy chews through anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Good for a week..
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say. 20 foot dog leash. Does the job. I wish the clip to attach to the collar was bigger. It's on the smaller side. Time will tell. Update- Clasp on the end fell off because the stiching came apart that held it on. Fortunately not while I was walking the dog. This could have ended very differently otherwise. Customer service handled problem I had with defective leash. Update-7/04/19 Leash ripped in 2. Terrible quality. Very thin.
customer_reviews.author: G.B.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: Would not recommend at all, the fabric is very thin. We bought because of the rave reviews about how sturdy it was, but upon taking it out of the package our initial impression was that it didn’t look durable or well made at all so we tried it out in our fenced in backyard first to be safe. We were with our dog the whole time while using it as a training aid and it literally snapped in-half within less than ten minutes. Don’t buy this, there are much better products out there for a little more money!
customer_reviews.author: Rick F.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I found the quality of this leash to be very poor. Buckle: much smaller and harder to operate than leashes in similar price range Nylon Lead: by far the thinnest material I have seen. My 10 week old pup got a hold of it and chewed through 75% of the lead within few minutes. Lead does not lay flat, because of it's thinnest it tends to curl under it's own weight. Very disappointing, not even going to try walking the dog as afraid it will break up in chewed up part.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Quality - So confused by other reviews
customer_reviews.text: I find the reviews for this product to be BIZARRE. How are there this many positive reviews with such a clearly cheap product that can't be used by medium/large dogs? Maybe I didn't read something in the description but the product I received is unusable. I will be recycling/throwing it out. PROS: - Cheap - Desired length - The leash itself is similar quality to a cheaper leash you'd buy (expected quality for LEASH - not clasp) - Could be used on a small dog. CONS: - Cheap clasp. (No, REALLY cheap clasp. Almost like weak aluminum feeling) - The leash material is the basic quality of most low-cost leashes. (expected but still not great)
customer_reviews.author: Random Dude

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and works but not super durable
customer_reviews.text: We purchased the orange one of these in 30 feet so we could take our dog to the beach and hiking and let him run around but still be on leash. The orange color is great because people can easily see that he's on a leash and not get freaked out thinking a giant dog is running loose. It works well but is not terribly sturdy. We've used it about 10 times and it's already fraying. I would NOT use it as an everyday tie-out, as I think it would fray and snap pretty quickly. It works well for training our dog to eventually come back off-leash and for occasional use.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of Many

customer_reviews.title: Invest in better quality
customer_reviews.text: This leash material is very lightweight and inexpensive. It’s not thick, smooth, or durable like leashes you’d find at a pet store. The one I received had a very sharp edge that would scratch me if it were wound around my wrist, legs... or caught an ankle. I will repurpose it for something else because it’s too sharp to use with my puppy. I tried washing it to see if it would soften up, but it did not. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Mommasaurus

customer_reviews.title: Stick to the cotton leads!
customer_reviews.text: Be careful...if larger dog pulls hard, this will really cut your hands. I'm going back to the cotton versions
customer_reviews.author: dandme

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: We have only used it twice for our medium sized yet VERY powerful Jindo girl. Great length and color to see where the leash is, BUT be VERY careful not to get your ankle caught in this leash while your pup is playing fetch, my husbands ankle was sliced open fairly badly (still a huge gash/open wound a week later) from his ankle being in the wrong spot at the wrong time. So just be aware of where your naked legs or ankles are! But other than that it has served its purpose of letting our pup run without running into trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Aimee

customer_reviews.title: Is there a "0" Star Rating!?!?!?
customer_reviews.text: I bought two leads on Amazon. One is 50' and this one 100'. The 50' is amazing, no twisting or tangling AT ALL. This product, however, twists upon itself EVERY TIME it's used!!! It so awesome untwisting 100" of nylon after it has been CAREFULLY rolled up after each use. I have had many nylon products through 35 years of pet parenting and I have never had any that is this poor quality. Don't be fooled, it's not the exceptionally long length causing it either....plain and simple...poor quality. Do yourself a favor and keep scrolling!!!
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Not made well
customer_reviews.text: This was delivered to me on Feb 6th. Because of all the rain we’ve had I just now took it out of the packaging to use on 3/15. I connected it to my dogs collar and when he got far enough out for there to be tension the lead just broke. I thought it was just a fluke, so I moved in closer and again when there was a little tension it broke again. I started pulling on different spots on the lead and each place I pulled it broke. This item is complete garbage. Because I waited to use I am unable to return so I’m out the money and have no training lead 😑
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: My dog does not pull, does not chew and thankfully does not run off. She spends very little time tied out while on job sites, second time she was tied out the webbing broke in half.
customer_reviews.author: Penny

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality - clasp much too small and flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I opened the bag and didn't even unravel the leash because as soon as I saw the clasping mechanism I knew it was not strong enough to hold my 70 pound German Shepherd. The size of the clasping mechanism is way too small for the length of the leash (100 feet). One pull on the clasp and I know it would break. I placed the leash back into the package and sent it back. I cancelled my order for the 50 foot leash. This leash requires a stronger, larger, more durable clasping mechanism. I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: NANCY L HALLER

customer_reviews.title: Broke first time out
customer_reviews.text: I have been dealing with health issues and a dg whom loves to run. First time out today she ran the metal broke and she was off leash. Very scary with cars nearby driving at 45 mph and hard for me because of my condition to contain the situation. I see now that a few days ago my window or return ended, I will fight with my credit card company over this, I buy a product to work not break first time nor put me in a situation of stress nor my dog in danger of being killed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DISINTEGRATED AFTER ONLY 2 1/2 MONTHS!
customer_reviews.text: If you want a low quality leash that falls apart quickly, this is the product for you!! After only 2 1/2 months, it has disintegrated .... not torn but disintegrated.... and we now have to buy a new leash. This product is NOT recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: Always Hoping

customer_reviews.title: Cheap materials, not very rugged. . By large Dog, they mean Yorkie
customer_reviews.text: This is for the 20 Foot lead. I had product for all of 5 minutes before a 19 lbs 10 week old GSD bit through the lead in one go. The material is very flimsy, not durable at all as the specifications state. I would not trust anything larger than a toy size dog with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: A+ lead line
customer_reviews.text: We love our bright orange lead line as we take our puppies to the mountains and let them have a little free rein. Having the bright orange color allows us to keep an eye on them easily. We have trained our puppies to swim off our kayaks even and having the lead line so long has helped us to keep them safe in case that got into any trouble while swimming! I will say that the lines did not hold up to puppies teeth :( but that is often expected... I would love to see a super thick maybe braided line offered specifically for puppies, other than that A+ in my book and have ordered 2 so far! LOVE
customer_reviews.author: Chantel F.

customer_reviews.title: Leash is fine, beware color substitutions
customer_reviews.text: Seems perfectly adequate as a light-duty leash (I’d give it 4 stars for that), but don’t count on getting the color you want. I ordered blue, and double-checked that I had as having the right color to match the harness I already have was the only reason I was buying this brand over others. When it came it was black, my order had been changed, and the listing no longer even had blue as having ever been an option. (It’s back now, a week later...curious.) I actually need the thing so I don’t have time to return it for the correct color, but it’s annoying that my order would be changed to just whatever color was in stock.
customer_reviews.author: jecondon

customer_reviews.title: Brittle in the sun!
customer_reviews.text: A few days in the sun and this leash is BRITTLE. I can literally tear it in half just by pulling it. The leash ripped in half and my dog got loose. Tried to tie it back together and just trying to tighten the knot, it ripped into smaller pieces. Waste of money if you are planning on leaving this leash in the sun. Good if you’re just taking it to the park for some runs.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna C.

customer_reviews.title: Frays easy
customer_reviews.text: I used this leash to practice recall with my puppy. The handle is fine, I wouldn't say it's super comfortable. The reason for my 1 star review is that it's already starting fraying after a month. It's nylon, and fraying is to be expected, just not after a month.
customer_reviews.author: PunkrockPM

customer_reviews.title: Has a variety of uses
customer_reviews.text: This is nothing more than a high quality dog leash that is exceptionally long at a fair price. We have not yet used it for any obedience work but when we take trips we have to have our dog tied on a leash. We do not leave her but have her leashed at all times with a no slip harness. This can be shortened to any length with an extra knot that comes out easily. I like the long leash option because she can still fetch balls but we do not have to worry about her running off or being hit with a car. This long leash provides options others do not and is solid and will not fail.
customer_reviews.author: P ShifTop Contributor: Fishing

customer_reviews.title: Never buying again
customer_reviews.text: My husky but through this the first time we used it. It took him less than 3 minutes to bite through it and then he got loose
customer_reviews.author: amazing1991

customer_reviews.title: Superior quality at a much lower price than at pet stores.
customer_reviews.text: Well-made lead, of very durable nylon material (similar to nylon leashes), and at a fraction of the price of less durable cotton ones available in pet stores. This 50 ft lead was less expensive than the 20-30 ft cotton leads at retail stores, and being brightly colored, is very easy to see and not trip over it while working with my dog. The longer length allows recall training at a much greater distance, particularly helpful in the case of a rescued, large adult dog who recalls easily at close distances, but typically ignores at greater distance.
customer_reviews.author: L. Raymond

customer_reviews.title: Won't Last
customer_reviews.text: Broke, tore twice in one play session after 6 months. My dog is a 14lb Peke. Strong dog but this was scary, she got away twice.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Davidson

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive Training Leash
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my newly acquired Cattle Dog that I got from the shelter. Working on recall and generally walking on a leash, this is the perfect tool. It is decently made and is sturdy. My trainer uses this also. Good product. Great price! *** One note. I was offered a $5 gift card for my review. Although I stand by my review I gave them 3 stars because they never credited me with the $5 gift card, therefore I feel that this company is less than honest.
customer_reviews.author: DJam

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and cheap enough for our needs.
customer_reviews.text: We are taking a training class that requires a long leash. We probably won’t use it too much and therefore didn’t wanna spend a whole lot on something fancy. This works just right for us. Granted, our dog is only 8 pounds... So her ability to pull it too much or chew it too much is fairly slim. There is no stretch, which is what we wanted. The 15 feet appears to be accurate. No padding or comfort measure on the wrist strap, but again, we were going for cheap so weren’t expecting anything fancy. So far works just fine for us, and the one day shipping was fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable to hold
customer_reviews.text: It hurts holding this leash. Don’t buy if your dog is too playful and can possibly drag you. Always scared my fingers will tear apart every time my dog would suddenly dash
customer_reviews.author: GG

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a lead that is long enough to allow the dogs to roam freely and still allow me to control them. This lead is light enough that it is easy to handle and with 2 dogs on long leads you need flexibility. The leads are also cotton and I have learned that I want a lead the dogs can chew through should I not be able to get to them if they get wrapped around some underbrush. This is a rare occurrence but it has happened so I'll stay with the chewable lead. These are just what I want and at a very reasonable price. I've ordered these before and will do so again.
customer_reviews.author: JeannieB

customer_reviews.title: I recommend something else
customer_reviews.text: Everything with this leash is fine but I’d recommend a strand of paracord with a leash clasp, in whatever length you need, over this. Because paracord is usually a rounded cylinder shape instead of this flat rectangular shape which has rough edges, which also I feel like would be rough on the dogs legs when you go to grab the leash to pull them back to you. Also for what it’s worth I underestimated the length I needed when I ordered the 15 feet leash so keep that in mind when ordering your length that for some people 15 feet isn’t even enough in a home. Product is fine though overall
customer_reviews.author: Juan Ramon

customer_reviews.title: Weak hardware = 3 stars
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a 20 - 30 ft length leash to train my dog to swim in the open ocean. Therefore, it is ok that is 3/4 width and no padded handle, and single nylon ply. I knew this before I bought it and did not intent to walk my dog on the 30 foot leash I bought. BUT, it gets 3 stars, because the most important part is poor quality. The hardware or clasp that attaches the leash to the dog collar is small, weak and the two end of the "closure" do not meet flush. Therefore, with any significant tug, the leash will open and fall off the collar. I have an 80 pound Newfoundland Chow mix.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for a little more room for your pooch to stand away and do their business or chase a snake. So far it has not snapped in a month of a husky tugging. I did not want a retractable leash with a dog that is a puller. No bulky plastic handle and it can slip around the waste if you just want to sit and read while they have a little room. I love the soft pink and not to heavy for putting in the pocket in case you want to put away and use a smaller leash. I hope to get a longer one soon as we work with training more.
customer_reviews.author: Jane DoeTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for training and playing with your puppy
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2-month-old Goldendoodle. The training program I am using shows the dog on a long leash. I live in a desert area. It is important that I do not lose control of my puppy. I purchased the 50 ft length for it works well given the length of my driveway and parking area. I chose orange so it could be easily seen on the gravel. The leash material is lightweight yet sturdy and the clasp is reliable. The leash is perfect for training at home and in open spaces. The price is reasonable and the product arrived in good time. I am very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Cedona

customer_reviews.title: Great for non-pulling dogs
customer_reviews.text: My dog pulls some but not excessively, except for when she's going for a squirrel or some other small animal. She is 70 lbs and quite strong. Lucky for me she doesn't chew on it nor do I leave her alone with it to give her a chance to chew it. For training this was great, it is great for practicing recalls. The biggest problem with the lead is me...I tend to get tangled in it. One thing I like about it is that I can tie it to my belt and take her out to the park and let her run with me as the center. She exercises herself while I stand there.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Long Lead
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. Sturdy and seems like it would be durable. Only had it for a couple weeks but seems to be holding up well. I use it at "off leash" dog parks but keep my puppy on a long lead because he doesn't come back everytime just yet. Has been completely soaked, ran through mud, dirt and sand and haven't had any problems with it. The only thing that would make this product better was of it was weatherproof. So it wasn't completely soaked after being in water and such. But then it would probably cost more than twice as much.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great for obedience training
customer_reviews.text: We originally purchased this to allow our deerhound to run in an open field and still have a way to grab her if she got too far away. It's the perfect length and lightweight enough that it doesn't seem to slow her down. Obviously this long of a leash always runs the risk of tangling up in the legs, but so far we've been lucky this hasn't happened. We've also started using this to teach recalls and the "come" command as we're able to get far enough away before using the command. If she doesn't come right away we just start "reeling her in" and praising her at that point for coming.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Does very well for the price point.
customer_reviews.text: This leash is probably exactly what you think you're paying for: a basic long leash that will hold up to standard dog use and not make your life worse. The material is soft and smooth like it should be, very flexible and works well as a "drag line" to let my dog run around with a long leash I can still use to catch him with. The clasp is fine, nothing special and may not hold up forever, but given the occasional use this leash will get in most dog's walking rotation, it is a choice that won't let you down.
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Lang

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for trying your pup to stay near you
customer_reviews.text: I'd like to train my puppy to be off-leash. This leash can be used to extend as far as you want by simply tying a knot. Keep your dog near you but with room to roam and move about in a safe area. Gradually extend the length and area. It's strong and coated with some sort of plastic which makes it almost impossible for pup to chew or have it break. Highly recommended by our trainer, who is tops in the Chicago for training dogs of all age. I got pink, Poppy is a female--but it shows up well in grass or any surface.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Boudreau

customer_reviews.title: snap came undone
customer_reviews.text: I bought 100 ft. seemed to be working well. Suddenly I notice my dog is not attached! I grabbed her before she noticed. Thankfully she was close. IDK what happened, but the snap had come off of her harness. She had been on for several minutes, so it's not like I didn't put it on there. The snap is pretty small anyway for a strong dog. I have no issues with the leash. I have a 60 lb Walker Treeing Coon Hound. She can pull when she gets excited. We have only had her 4 months and that is why we need the training lead. I can't trust the snap, so I have to return. John's wife
customer_reviews.author: john P

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Leave It Outside!
customer_reviews.text: Received 5/7/2020. Used to tie out a 12 lb dog for 15 minutes each afternoon, weather permitting. She is extremely docile, slowly putters around, never runs, tugs or chews. Color faded from bright pink to white within a few weeks. No biggie. But today I went to coil up the leash to hang it on it’s hook and it literally fell apart in my hands. Please see photo. It has totally deteriorated after only 3 months. The lightest touch breaks it. I’ll give 2 stars because it was fine for a while, but don’t leave it outside!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca LTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: I Wanted to Like This, But I Don't
customer_reviews.text: We have a GSD just a bit over a year and wanted to work with her on 'recalls' (letting her roam and then calling her back). This 30' leash is pretty thin/flimsy and very uncomfortable to hold. I don't think that if we clipped this to her collar, it'd be strong enough to hold her if she really wanted to go after a bunny, etc. We did try it out in the yard and she saw a bird; I tried grabbing the length of the leash to slow her down and it gave me 'leash burn' on my hand (my fault, I suppose). This leash tangles really easily, too.
customer_reviews.author: Smile SaurusTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to keep untangled
customer_reviews.text: I ended up throwing this away because no matter what I did to roll it up and keep it neat, it always ended up a tangled mess that's impossible to untangle and therefore impossible to use. I have other 100' long lines that do not have this problem. I think the issue is the material; it's thin like a nylon ribbon. I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki Norris

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Used this to keep my dog on the property since he likes to wander, just attached it a tree and then to him and he has 50 ft to explore and I dont have to worry about him wandering and getting hurt like hes done a few times already. He is only outside maybe a couple hours a day, but it has been rained on (I leave it attached to the tree even if the dog isnt attached to it) and it's still in good shape if I get 6 months use out of it itll be worth the price, but I dont see any signs of it getting weaker yet.
customer_reviews.author: Nory M. Aldama

customer_reviews.title: Great leash wish it was a little thicker
customer_reviews.text: For the price it is a good leash and does exactly what I need it to do. Mostly it drags on the ground behind my dog as we are walking as I train her to stay by me on walks. I wanted a long leash so that I could easily step on it if she decides to take off or I need to keep her close. I only use this for that purpose when we are walking in areas where there is no traffic. It's thinner than any other leash I have purchased but it seems to be holding up well. My dog is small (only 17 lbs) so it doesn't need to be a particularly sturdy leash.
customer_reviews.author: Colonial Girl

customer_reviews.title: Freedom for my dog and myself
customer_reviews.text: I bought this leash because my young dog wanted to explore my snowy backyard and I didn't feel like traipsing through the deep show. He wasn't sure of the leash to begin with because it was so long, but once we got outside and I told him that he could go play in the snow while I kept ahold of the handle, he got excited very quickly and started running around like crazy. This leash kept my dog safe and happy with not having to be right next to me all the time and it kept me from getting cold, wet and uncomfortable. We are both very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bear Reader

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Buy
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy and poorly made. I do not trust the clasp. I returned it immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Rich C

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality and Color
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 very powerful, young dogs that I needed a strong leash for. I did a lot of research and decided, based on reviews from others who had purchased this leash, to give it a try. I'm glad I did. I ordered it purple and the 15' length. I like that my dog has some room to wonder and to do her business. The material for the leash is strong and I don't worry about the leash breaking. I'm happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: CShik64

customer_reviews.title: My dog hates this
customer_reviews.text: I have a timid dog and she is terrified of this leash. I don’t know if she fears having so much free range when outside or what, but she doesn’t like it and refuses to walk away from me on it. A short leash? No problem! But this? she’s had a fear of it since the package arrived! And I’m so sad because I wanted her to have more outside adventures with me because I can’t navigate hillsides very well and wanted to give her more leash to trot around on, but she just doesn’t like it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Fi

customer_reviews.title: to light and gets entangled in dogs legs
customer_reviews.text: It concerned me that he could get his legs damaged because several turns and he was bound up. He is a standard poodle puppy with really long legs. plus it took him about a minute to chew it in 1/2.
customer_reviews.author: B. Bacchus

customer_reviews.title: room to run and great for training on ecollar
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Brittney she has tons of energy and loves to go out and sniff everything. I have been training her with a ecollar and this line works great. Gives her plenty of room to run and play and sniff and for us to work on recall but the peace of mind that i can still "get a hold of her" if i have to. The only thing i recommend is a travel bag, nothing fancy but a nice slip string bag would be great. could even put your logo on it because it is so cute. :) Thank you, Eva and Wicket
customer_reviews.author: EK

customer_reviews.title: 100' Hard to use - buy shorter lead
customer_reviews.text: My dog is a runner but this leash was so long that it was hard to handle, wrap up, and would drag on the ground behind my dog and scare her. I ended up using a much thinner rope with 2 dog clips on the ends and that has worked better. This would be good for a bigger dog or even a horse! This should only be used in wide open spaces because it could easily get wrapped around a tree. I should have bought a shorter one but I still think the thickness dragging on the ground behind her would scare her.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: JUST WORKS! You'll want a winder of some kind...
customer_reviews.text: Make yourself a winder for it, or find one. I made wire hooks and duct-taped them to either end of an ~18"cardboard tube. Drilled a 3/16" hole at each end. Hook the handle over the end of the tube, wind wind wind, then hook the leash clip into the little hole. Stashed and ready for next time! My coonhound/shepherd is a risk to disappear after deer or squirrels, so I use this to play Fetch and Frisbee with her. She learned quick that she can run past me for nearly 100 feet of flat-out straight run, then lop back to deliver the ball.
customer_reviews.author: Lo Faszt

customer_reviews.title: Crap Training Leash
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was getting a good training leash when I ordered this. It was not to be. Very thin, very light, very wide. It's hard to hang on to even when knots are tied through out the length of the leash. It's so light the slightest breeze blows it around making it difficult to grab when needed. I found a more substantial leash elsewhere and pitched this one into the trash. Will NOT buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Julie A. Swope

customer_reviews.title: Rougher than Expected
customer_reviews.text: I really love the length of this leash, but I'm really hesitant to use it because the nylon is so rough. If it slides through my hand too fast it would surely cause a rope burn, and since the intent was to use it for running around at the park, there's prone to be some instances where the leash slides in my hand. It's also harder to grip if she's pulling since it's rough. It's definitely not a soft nylon leash like you'd get at the pet store. I've only used it a couple of times.
customer_reviews.author: J. Watkins

customer_reviews.title: Good long leash
customer_reviews.text: We love these long leashes for our dog. She is not always a good listener but she also has a ton of energy. We have a lot of yard so we can hook her leash to a lead attached to the house and she has a large area to wander. Sometimes we like to play outside with her not connected to a structure and still have a long distance to catch up to her if she gets distracted and wanders. It is a soft material so when we use these at work and she is alone for a while she can chew through. But overall good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jess L

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight long line
customer_reviews.text: Good basic long line for training or just letting your dog wander in an un-fenced yard. Our dog likes to hang out in the yard and is pretty obedient, but he's also super prey motivated and we were worried he might run off after a squirrel or rabbit. This line is long enough that he can explore the whole yard but not run away. It is also light enough that he can move about freely without having to drag an extra long cable with him. He pretty much doesn't notice it is there.
customer_reviews.author: B4E1

customer_reviews.title: Happy with it and the dogs are re-learning "come"
customer_reviews.text: It has been working fine with my four dogs (all 80 - 110lbs) but they do not lunge. It is a little lighter weight than a typical leash and I can see how it can snap if a dog does lunge on it so just be aware and it should last you some time. We adopt only special needs and seniors so their training skills to "come" may be lacking. This helps train them and/or remind them as they do tend to forget due to their conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Avidreader

customer_reviews.title: Very durable and secure!
customer_reviews.text: I have two large dogs and these feel very durable and secure! We used them at a public beach and I wish I had gotten these a long time ago. Loved giving the pups some room to explore and fetch without having to run right alongside them. Also excited to use these with our new puppy in our backyard so I won’t have to walk her in the middle of the night and can just let her roam while I stay on the porch!
customer_reviews.author: Whitney Jane Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great so far!
customer_reviews.text: We have a huge yard and my akita only will go to the bathroom at the very back or middle of the yard. She has a tendency to "explore" once she's used the bathroom and not come back. She refuses to potty on a leash for some weird reason. I got the 30ft one hoping she would actually go to the bathroom while keeping her safe and so far its been working great. The 30ft allows my dog to reach the middle of the yard without having to walk past my driveway. I can't say much for the durability/sturdiness because I haven't had it long, but I fear my dog will break it since it's thin.
customer_reviews.author: Zucchini Boat

customer_reviews.title: Great until it breaks
customer_reviews.text: I do like this leash but am giving it a low rating for the fabric breaking at the clasp quite quickly. Fortunately I was able to tie a knot and still use it. The issue is I have a short flexible extender on it so the clasp has been dragging on the ground. My last similar leash did the same thing but sturdier rope ones don’t break.
customer_reviews.author: Knittingloie

customer_reviews.title: Broke Twice!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to keep our German Shepherd from running out. I felt like it was nice to have the flat rope rather than the round for safety, however, after a few weeks, it broke and our dog ran down to the neighbors house. Luckily, we were right there and he came right back. We tied it back together thinking it was a fluke. A week later, late at night, we took him out and a coyote was on the other side of the pool, without much effort he tugged and it broke again. We lost site of him. Again, luckily, he returned. I would not recommend this for people who are interested in the safety of their pet.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Great for dog on limited activity
customer_reviews.text: We picked this leash up to use with our 9 year old Catahoula that has a partially torn ACL in the back yard. We are fenced in so he is very used to having full roam of the yard and was very stubborn when walking around the yard with a standard leash, the 20 foot allows him to have a little bit more freedom while keeping him from playing with his younger sister. It is very light weight and seems to be of good quality, the 20 foot works great for our needs but it is definitely shorter then I would get if this were to be used as a training leash.
customer_reviews.author: Addie15

customer_reviews.title: Gives my puppy freedom while maintaining control
customer_reviews.text: I can’t say weather this holds up to chewing because I don’t allow her the chance. I do love how I can play ball outside with our German Shepherd puppy in our unfenced country yard where the occasional car goes by like a bat out of hell and not feel scared that she’ll run out of my range of control. It was a great purchase. I bought the 50 ft. I was debating the 100 ft but I’m glad I didn’t. I feel the 50 ft is plenty long enough. I feel anything longer would be in the way both outside and in.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: a good long lead for training
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I expected. Nothing fancy, but definitely a perfect super long leash for training purposes. I would never keep my dog tied up with this somewhere because it's not that kind of a lead line. You would need a totally different kind for that! But for supervised play and training, it's absolutely perfect! I got the 20 ft which takes a bit of getting used to handling that much leash with an active dog, but it's soft and thin and easy to get the knack pretty quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: Easy to see, multiple uses
customer_reviews.text: Bought with recommendation from dog trainer to help with recall. Ordered orange because of other reviewers suggestion on seeing it well in all terrain. Have used it a few times by hand-holding and also fixing it around a tree (temporarily while backyard gates had to be opened and so he wouldn’t run out). Definitely good to have on hand whatever the need. I bought 50 foot for my large dog (60lbs 32 inches tall (withers)). Did not see any defects on leash or hardware. He is a chewer but hasn’t chewed it yet. The 50 foot gives him plenty of room to roam vs the 25 ft led I bought when he was smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Jerminator

customer_reviews.title: handle broke after 2.5 months
customer_reviews.text: I walk our 3yr old boxer every morning on a golf course. The long lead allows her to run and explore while still be able to control her. Pink lead has gotten dirty, and I may soon put in washer to see if it will come clean. Hardware has held up well. Strap broke after a couple months. Still think leash is a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality,Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: The Hi Kiss Dog/Puppy Obedience Recall Training Agility Lead is good quality at a surprisingly great price. I use this this leash to keep my dog in an area with no fence on occasion. My pup normally stays in the fenced back yard, but occasionally likes to be with me as I do chores in the front yard. He is a beagle pup of 4 months, so I still have a lot of work to do on his training. The clasp on the end of the leash appears to be of good quality and I have had no issues as of yet. Overall its a bargain at the price and you have many colors to choose from.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Casteel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for training!
customer_reviews.text: We got the 50 ft training leash for our pup so we could play fetch at the park with no worries. This is perfect for that 100%. She loves to run back and forth and this gives her enough slack to run without being too far away or running off. The leash is tough, our dog is small but it seems like it would hold up well to chewing. The color is also very pretty! My only downside is how long it takes to wind up a leash that long lol!
customer_reviews.author: Destiny

customer_reviews.title: nice quality
customer_reviews.text: The leash is great. I ordered it for my fence climbing dog so she didn't feel as restricted as she would be on a short leash in our back yard. My biggest suggestion is ordering a dark color because the leash quickly got muddy as my dog ran around our yard. My dog is a 75 pound hound and the leash held up to her pulling, she did chew through it very quickly when I wasn't paying attention but she would be able to chew through steel if she put her mind to it.
customer_reviews.author: Jon White

customer_reviews.title: Quality/Price ratio is Great
customer_reviews.text: The Hi Kiss longline is a gift at $10. Seems like it will last for miles of walks, has a secure handle and has just enough stretch for those times your pup is too excited. I started using this as soon as it arrived and it’s a great training aid and provides security for those times I want to give my buddy simulated freedom. I really feel this will take us to the next level and Hi Kiss provides a quality product for the effort. PS- Orange really shows in the grass.
customer_reviews.author: biasdr

customer_reviews.title: Great Dog Run
customer_reviews.text: We use this leash as a run in our back yard by anchoring it to a post in the middle of the yard. It provides our hound with plenty of running space and keeps him in the yard. We have purchased several of these items over the last 2-3 years, some as replacement, some for other locations. It is a good product and lasts 6-8 months outside in the grass during all weather. We have pretty intense heat during the summer and I feel this exceeds expectations.
customer_reviews.author: FourBoysMom

customer_reviews.title: The lead was wider than the description indicated which makes ...
customer_reviews.text: The lead was wider than the description indicated which makes it too clumsy to use. I discussed this with the seller who denied that it wasn’t as promised, even though I have the lead in hand and can measure it. Buy from a more reliable seller.
customer_reviews.author: K. A. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 193 days.
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I wish was different is I wish I purchased the 50 foot instead. So far, it's been great. Update.... Received on March 13, 2020 and today, September 22, 2020, the lease broke. Lasted 193 days. My 10-month old golden retriever, weighing just under 50 pounds, broke the leash. He didn't chew through it. Disappointed. The company refunded me. That's pretty solid so I'll definitely give them three stars for their customer service. I'm buying a leash through another company though.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the 50 ft and it fits my needs. I’ve used it for long line recall training, playing fetch at the park, hikes, and tied it around a tree a couple of times. Had it for a couple of months now and I see minor fraying (it’s gone through heavy usage) on some parts. It washes pretty well with a quick detergent soak and scrub. My biggest gripe is it gets knots easily and is a nightmare to unknot if it gets pulled too tight. Other than that it’s been great.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Puppy can chew through in less than 30 seconds
customer_reviews.text: This lead does not stand up to teeth whatsoever. It won't take a heavy chewer to chew right through this and run on their merry way. Have fixed this lead at least half a dozen times over a couple months. This is great if you want to teach your dog to try and chew through their leashes (once it works one time, they'll keep on trying). I guess the plus side is it's not too thick that you can't tie it back together. The leash is also rough, so it can leave a burn on your hand if the dog pulls and it runs through your palm.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: New puppy Trainer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Hi Kiss long lead for Canine Good Citizen Training, I'd bought the Orange in a 30 ft., and decided on the Black in a 20 ft. While working on crate Training I'd had a new puppy who I did not know was very skilled at chewing the long lead- this is my second purchase, now we are much better at not chewing the lead and walking with it and are still doing our Obedience work. Really good price for this equipment, and it's easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Jo Mattingly

customer_reviews.title: Update - tore in less than two months
customer_reviews.text: ---- Update ----- The actual leash tore in less than two months of use. There's no bite marks or anything, so I know he didn't chew it – seems it just wasn't up to the job. ---- End update ---- I needed a leash to use to tie out my GSD, as he keeps on breaking the chains we put out there (they rust then he snaps them). I'm hoping this fabric will hold out longer! It's more flexible and, obviously, rust proof, so it seems like it will work! I actually bought two – one for a tie-out, and another for when we go to the lake so he can swim farther out!
customer_reviews.author: Eric F.

customer_reviews.title: Clasp not heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: Twice now the clasp came undone and my new 6 month rescue puppy got away. He's only thirty-five pounds. I could see if he was 100lbs but even then it shouldn't happen. I love the length however the clasp is not safe. I would like to be reimbursed and I will take leash somewhere where a heavier clasp can be sewn on.
customer_reviews.author: Narruc1

customer_reviews.title: Disintegrated
customer_reviews.text: Updated review: Less than a year later this leash fell apart in multiple pieces. It never had any strain on it, but was left outside. Disappointed. Original review: This is a great long line to keep my cat safe in my backyard when we're outside. It's lightweight so my cat doesn't feel "stuck," and its bright orange color lets me find my cat immediately should I lose sight of him. We're both very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: AF

customer_reviews.title: Great leash, Great price
customer_reviews.text: This leash is so perfect for my puppy. It’s gives him the option to roam around without my worrying that he’ll run away. I got the red color and it is even more vibrant than I expected, which I love, so people don’t trip over it. The material of the leash feels very nice and thick so he can’t chew through it. The only reason I didn’t give it 5 stars is because the latch doesn’t feel as sturdy as my Walmart leash and I’m worried that once he gets bigger it won’t be strong enough for him. I’ll update once we get to that point!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonR92

customer_reviews.title: Very happy dog
customer_reviews.text: I love it, and so does my dog! It's wonderful as a stepping stone to off-leash training. She feels like she can run forever, and her recall is improving. Seems tough and durable. Edit: the first time i let my kids use this leash without me, the dog chewed through it in multiple places. :( Edit 2: I fixed the old one (it lost a couple feet but I sewed it back together) and I bought a 50 ft lead from this same listing. She is a power chewer, but we are still super happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Mystee

customer_reviews.title: Great leash
customer_reviews.text: Great long leash for the price. I don’t have a fence in my front yard but I like to give my dogs room to run around safely. Having this leash gives me peace of mind and allows me to control them when needed. With two puppies this leash is a must! I know this product will hold up as long as my dogs don’t chew it, the leash is pretty standard. This is priced very well compared to pet stores and I would definitely repurchase if my dogs chew through it.
customer_reviews.author: Treyvo

customer_reviews.title: Great way to wake up!
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this lead until... I woke up and let our Shepard outside. She sees a rabbit. She runs for the rabbit. She's supposed to stop because she's on the lead. But she keeps going. And going. All around the neighborhood. Would have been nice if the lead didn't snap. But hey, I woke up really quick with a nice sprint in my socks chasing her! If you have rabbits in your yard, do NOT get this lead. Or just buy a lead that doesn't rip in half.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality. Good price.
customer_reviews.text: I wish I got a shorter leash than 100 feet. However, the quality is great for the price. For me it is too long for my 20 lb westie. I got it so she can have a long leash at the park in an open field. The length of 100 feet kinda weighs her down a litte to walk that far. 5 stars for quality and price. I got what I ordered and I am pleased. My decision making just wasn't on point. I hope the photo helps put it in perspective.
customer_reviews.author: Purchaser

customer_reviews.title: Strong. Sturdy. Perfect. Great colors.
customer_reviews.text: I've bought two sizes of this leash. I neglected to write a review the first time but both apply here. This is a good long sturdy leash. It's exactly what it looks like. It's not super thin or flimsy at all. The metal parts are good and sturdy. The price was great! I and my horribly imperious leash walking cat both are perfectly happy with this leash. I don't expect it to be replaced for a long time. I ordered purple at first, was quite pretty. Pink is quite pretty too. Judging from mine I suspect all the colors look great.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: Cheap leash, defeated by UV light...
customer_reviews.text: Not sure I would recommend this for a large dog that pulls as the hook is not overly robust and the handle would dig in to your wrist. For small dogs or ones that don't pull much it's perfect. I got the orange one so I don't accidentally run it over with my lawnmower. I will update my review if I find any issues over time but so far so good. Update: the leash did not survive the sun. It became brittle and broke after a few months outside. I will not suggest this to others.
customer_reviews.author: Duncan MacRae

customer_reviews.title: Super sturdy, reliable clasp, bright classy color, convenient & comfortable width!
customer_reviews.text: Really impressed with this lightweight, sturdy long lead. I bought it for training and playing with my service dog in training. We tried it out first indoors at the facility (because I'm super nervous about clasps and hooks breaking free), and all was well! On Saturday, we'll have a good romp outdoors and have a chance to play with toys and practice down-stays and recall at a greater distance outdoors. This is so important for me to feel confident with my new service companion! Thank you for making a product I can trust! (and the shipping was ridiculously speedy to boot!)
customer_reviews.author: Anne Kyzer

customer_reviews.title: Great leash for dogs that need to run but has neighbors around.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Made of very strong fabric. It would probably take a dog a really long time to chew through this! My dog can now run through the fields without having to worry about me keeping up. Cons: Parts of the leash wants to curl up really tight but straightens out pretty easily the more you walk. Great product that I'm totally satisfied with. Considering ordering the Orange one next.👍👍
customer_reviews.author: JMB987

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my son's 1 year old Aussie who visits often. She is full of energy and wants to stay outside as much as she can. she is fast and can disappear quickly. She is becoming a well trained pup but the occasional rabbit or bird is still to enticing not to chase after. I can loop this leash around a deck post and hook it to her harness so when I am in the yard working she can be out with me but I don't have to worry about her darting off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Hi Kiss Dog/Puppy Obedience Recall Training Agility Lead - 15ft 20ft 30ft 50ft 100ft Training Leash - Great for Training, Play, Camping, or Backyard
feature_bullets: DIMENSIONS - This dog leash measures 3/4in wide by 20 feet long. Great for hiking, camping, training, hunting, backyard, beach, recall training, outdoor play with tennis balls, and swimming!
LONG LEASH: This training leash is great for teaching your dog recalls. It has the length needed to allow them to wander and ensure your command to come! is obeyed.

NYLON TRAINING LEAD - This durable, long, nylon dog training leash will outlast cotton leashes. All stitching is reinforced and the nickel plated clip swivels to resist twisting. Our long dog leash is great for medium and large dogs. You'll love using it as a backyard dog leash, for off leash dog training, and more.
Allows you to teach your dog recalls and other obedience skills.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
